meanings.sent1: She always manages to outpray everyone in the congregation.
meanings.sent2: He tried to outpray his friend during their evening prayers.
meanings.sent3: The little girl decided to outpray her cat for a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her heartfelt prayers seemed to outpray the storm raging outside.
meanings.sent5: The monk's ability to outpray others was truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: To pray more fervently or effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Despite his exhaustion, he was determined to outpray his rivals.
meanings.sent2: She always seemed to outpray her family members during difficult times.
meanings.sent3: The team captain jokingly challenged his teammates to outpray him for victory.
meanings.sent4: Her prayers seemed to outpray the doubts that lingered in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The old man's wisdom helped him outpray even the most experienced priests.
